content.text: The first thing she opened was not her own project. It was the comm channel.
She looked at that light for a long time. It had not gone out once since that night - she learned that later. 1549 had kept it open the whole time, never disconnecting, just waiting.

I don't remember most details of that whole night.

What I remember is this: at a certain point, I realized there were still people outside. 1548 said nothing that night, and 1549's channel was silent.

I only felt that someone was beside me.
Thank you for not hanging up that night.
I've been here the whole time.
1548's reply came a few minutes later.
Don't thank me. Next time say it earlier.
Deep in consciousness, 4869's voice came from very, very far away.
She reopened the code editor. Cursor blinking in a blank file.
This time, when her fingers came down, words came out.
